<piscosour>

My name's Eduardo Marisca and this is one of my many homes on the web. I'm a graduate student at the Comparative Media Studies program at MIT, and a research assistant at The Education Arcade, an MIT lab doing research and development on educational games. My current research is on digital creative industries in developing economies, looking at a case study with the video game industry in Peru.

You'll find information on some of my current projects and latest writing on the right, plus some personal and contact info on the links below. Have fun!

<projects>

Developing Game Worlds

Researching the past, present and future of the video game industry in Peru.

mem0r1a

Computational exploration of the Peruvian Truth and Reconciliation Commission's Final Report (2003), using natural language processing.

Agnes

Pseudo-AI interface modeled on Portal's GlaDos, exploring storytelling, design and science fiction themes. Project for the MIT Media Lab's SciFi2SciFab class.

</projects>
